required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Trial to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of a New Full Length Recombinant Human FVIII for Hemophilia A
clinical_study.official_title: A Two Part Randomized Cross-Over Trial to Evaluate the Pharmacokinetics, Efficacy, and Safety Profile of Plasma Protein-Free Recombinant FVIII Formulated With Sucrose (BAY81-8973) in Previously Treated Subjects With Severe Hemophilia A Under Prophylaxis Therapy

brief_summary.textblock: The study will assess the pharmacokinetics (part A) safety, tolerability, and efficacy of prophylaxis treatment (2 to 3 times a week) (part B) with BAY81-8973 over a one year period (split into two six month treatment periods). The study will compare 2 different methods (assays) for measuring the amount of study drug, the chromogenic substrate assay per European Pharmacopeia (CS/EP) with the classical assay (Chromogenic Substrate Adjusted, CS/ADJ). During one six month period patients will receive the study drug where the dose has been measured using the" (CS/EP) and during the other six months period the dose will be measured based on the Chromogenic Substrate Adjusted assay CS/ADJ)

primary_outcome.measure: Part A - Area Under the Drug Concentration-time Curve (AUC)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Samples taken at pre-injection, and at 0.25, 0.5, 1, 3, 6, 8, 24, 30 and 48 hours post injection. AUC calculated from time of injection to infinity.
primary_outcome.description: To examine the Pharmacokinetic (PK) characteristics of BAY 81-8973 and ensure that the new drug is similar to Kogenate FS. All results are based on the chromogenic assay.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Samples taken at pre-injection, and at 0.25, 0.5, 1, 3, 6, 8, 24, 30 and 48 hours post injection.
primary_outcome.description: To examine the PK characteristics of BAY81-8973 and ensure that the new drug is similar to Kogenate FS. All results are based on the chromogenic assay.

primary_outcome.measure: Part B - Annualized Number of Total Bleeds
primary_outcome.description: The annualized number of bleeds experienced by participants

secondary_outcome.measure: Part B - The in Vivo Recovery Values of Human Factor VIII (FVIII)
secondary_outcome.description: The amount of Factor VIII found in blood samples taken after the injection of the study drug at the beginning of the CS/EP treatment period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Part B - Annualized Number of Bleeds in Each 6-month Potency Assignment Period
secondary_outcome.description: The annualized number of bleeds experienced by participants in each of the two treatment periods

secondary_outcome.measure: Part B - Control of Bleeding as Measured by the Number of Injections Required to Treat a Bleed
secondary_outcome.description: The number of injections needed by participants to stop a bleed

secondary_outcome.measure: Part B - Changes From Baseline at 12 Months in Quality of Life (QoL) as Measured by Transformed Total Score of Haemo-QoL Questionnaire
secondary_outcome.description: A measure of how treatment with BAY81-8973 affected the daily life of participants. the scoring system has 100 points. 0 is the worst possible score. 100 is the best possible score. Positive changes from baseline indicate an improvement in quality of life and negative changes indicate a deterioration.

secondary_outcome.measure: Part B - Changes From Baseline at 12 Months in Utility Index as Measured by EQ-5D Questionaire
secondary_outcome.description: A measure of how treatment with BAY81-8973 affected the daily life of participants. 1.0 = Best possible score, -0.594 = Worst possible score. Positive changes from baseline indicate an improvement and negative changes indicate a deterioration.

secondary_outcome.measure: Part A - Number of Participants With Inhibitory Antibody Formation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 6 weeks after first injection of study drug
secondary_outcome.description: A test to ensure that participants have not developed antibodies that will interfere with the action of BAY81-8973

secondary_outcome.measure: Part B - Number of Participants With Incidence of Inhibitory Antibody Formation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 12 months after drug administration
secondary_outcome.description: A test to ensure that participants have not developed antibodies that will interfere with the action of BAY81-8973

secondary_outcome.measure: Part C - Number of Participants With Incidence of Inhibitory Antibody Formation
secondary_outcome.description: A test to ensure that participants have not developed antibodies that will interfere with the action of BAY81-8973

secondary_outcome.measure: Part A - Number of Participants With Incidence of Antibody Formation to Heat-shock Protein (HSP-70)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 6 weeks after drug administration
secondary_outcome.description: A test to analyze the formation of antibodies to HSP-70

secondary_outcome.measure: Part B - Number of Participants With Incidence of Antibody Formation to Heat-shock Protein (HSP-70)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 12 months after drug administration
secondary_outcome.description: A test to analyze the formation of antibodies to HSP-70

secondary_outcome.measure: Part C - Number of Participants With Incidence of Antibody Formation to Heat-shock Protein (HSP-70)
secondary_outcome.description: A test to analyze the formation of antibodies to HSP-70

secondary_outcome.measure: Part A - Number of Participants With Incidence of Antibody Formation to Host Cell Proteins (HCP)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 4 weeks after drug administration
secondary_outcome.description: A test to ensure that participants have not developed antibodies to HCP during the study

secondary_outcome.measure: Part B - Number of Participants With Incidence of Antibody Formation to Host Cell Proteins (HCP)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 12 months after drug administration
secondary_outcome.description: A test to ensure that participants have not developed antibodies to HCP during the study

secondary_outcome.measure: Part C - Number of Participants With Incidence of Antibody Formation to Host Cell Proteins (HCP)
secondary_outcome.description: A test to ensure that participants have not developed antibodies to HCP during the study

secondary_outcome.measure: Part B - Number of Participants With Assessment of the Hemostasis During Major Surgery
secondary_outcome.time_frame: An average of 1 month after start of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: An assessment made by surgeons of how effective BAY81-8973 was in stopping bleeding during major operations

secondary_outcome.measure: Part C - Number of Participants With Assessment of the Hemostasis During Major Surgery
secondary_outcome.description: An assessment made by surgeons of how effective BAY81-8973 was in stopping bleeding during major operations

arm_group.arm_group_label: Arm 1: Recombinant Factor VIII (BAY81-8973) then Kogenate FS
arm_group.description: Part A - Arm 1: Participants first received one single intravenous (IV) injection of BAY81-8973 50 IU/kg, then 1 single IV injection of Kogenate FS (BAY14-2222) 50 IU/kg with a wash-out period of at least 2-3 days in between

arm_group.arm_group_label: Arm 2: Kogenate FS then Recombinant Factor VIII (BAY81-8973)
arm_group.description: Part A - Arm 2: Participants first received one single intravenous (IV) injection of Kogenate FS (BAY14-2222) 50 IU/kg, then 1 single IV injection of BAY81-8973 50 IU/kg with a wash-out period of at least 2-3 days in between

arm_group.arm_group_label: Arm 3: Recombinant Factor VIII by CS/EP then by CS/ADJ
arm_group.description: Part B - Arm 3: Participants received IV injection of BAY81-8973 at 20-50 IU/kg 2-3 times per week with BAY81-8973 measured by Chromogenic Substrate Assay Potency Per European Pharmacopeia for 6 months and then crossed over to study drug measured by Chromogenic Substrate Assay/Adjusted to Label Potency for 6 months

arm_group.arm_group_label: Arm 4: Recombinant Factor VIII by CS/ADJ then by CS/EP
arm_group.description: Part B - Arm 4:. Participants received IV injection of BAY81-8973 at 20-50 IU/kg 2-3 times per week with BAY81-8973 measured by Chromogenic Substrate Assay/Adjusted to Label Potency for 6 months and then crossed over to study drug measured by Chromogenic Substrate Assay Per European Pharmacopeia for 6 months

arm_group.arm_group_label: Arm 5: Recombinant Factor VIII by CS/EP
arm_group.description: Part C - Arm 5: Participants received a loading dose of approximately 50 IU/kg of BAY 81-8973 before the first surgical incision followed by further treatment with BAY 81-8973 according to surgical requirements for up to 3 weeks

intervention.description: Single dose of BAY81-8973 crossed over to single dose of Kogenate FS
intervention.arm_group_label: Arm 1: Recombinant Factor VIII (BAY81-8973) then Kogenate FS

intervention.description: Single dose of Kogenate FS crossed over to Single dose of BAY81-8973
intervention.arm_group_label: Arm 2: Kogenate FS then Recombinant Factor VIII (BAY81-8973)

intervention.description: Participants received IV injections of BAY81-8973 at 20-50 IU/kg 2-3 times per week with BAY81-8973 measured by Chromogenic Substrate Assay Potency Per European Pharmacopeia (CS/EP) for 6 months and by Chromogenic Substrate Assay/Adjusted to Label Potency (CS/ADJ) for 6 months, sequence according to randomization.
intervention.arm_group_label: Arm 3: Recombinant Factor VIII by CS/EP then by CS/ADJ
Arm 4: Recombinant Factor VIII by CS/ADJ then by CS/EP

intervention.description: Participants received a loading dose of approximately 50 IU/kg of BAY 81-8973 before the first surgical incision followed by further treatment with BAY 81-8973 according to surgical requirements for up to 3 weeks
intervention.arm_group_label: Arm 5: Recombinant Factor VIII by CS/EP

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male, aged 12 to 65 years
- Severe hemophilia A defined as < 1% FVIII:C
- >/= 150 days of previous treatment with FVIII in lifetime
- Currently receiving on-demand or any type of prophylaxis treatment regimen with any FVIII product
- No history of or current FVIII inhibitors
Exclusion Criteria:
- Presence of another bleeding disease that is different from hemophilia A (e.g., von Willebrand disease, hemophilia B)
- Low platelet count, abnormal kidney function, or liver disease
- Received treatment with immune suppressing drugs within the last 3 months prior or requires treatment during the study. (Some drugs for hepatitis C, Human immunodeficiency virus (HIV), and steroids are allowed)
- Receiving or has received other experimental drugs within 3 months prior to study entry
- Allergy to Factor VIII or hamsters or mouse protein

results_reference.citation: Kitchen S, Katterle Y, Beckmann H, Maas Enriquez M. Chromogenic assay for BAY 81-8973 potency assignment has no impact on clinical outcome or monitoring in patient samples. J Thromb Haemost. 2016 Jun;14(6):1192-9. doi: 10.1111/jth.13322. Epub 2016 May 3.

Oldenburg J, Windyga J, Hampton K, Lalezari S, Tseneklidou-Stoeter D, Beckmann H, Maas Enriquez M. Safety and efficacy of BAY 81-8973 for surgery in previously treated patients with haemophilia A: results of the LEOPOLD clinical trial programme. Haemophilia. 2016 May;22(3):349-53. doi: 10.1111/hae.12839. Epub 2016 Mar 1.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Participants were recruited from specialized hemophilia treatment centers.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 14 participants were enrolled in each of Arms 1 and 2 in Part A. Of these, 11 participants continued into each of Arms 3 and 4 in Part B. Arm 3 enrolled 20 and Arm 4 enrolled 21 additional participants who had not participated in Part A. Arm 5 enrolled 5 participants specifically for surgery in Part C who had not participated in Parts A or B.

group.title: Arm 1: Recombinant Factor VIII (BAY81-8973) Then Kogenate FS
group.description: Part A - Arm 1: Participants first received one single intravenous (IV) injection of BAY81-8973 50 IU/kg, then 1 single IV injection of Kogenate FS (BAY14-2222) 50 IU/kg with a wash-out period of at least 2-3 days in between

group.title: Arm 2: Kogenate FS Then Recombinant Factor VIII (BAY81-8973)

group.title: Arm 3: Recombinant Factor VIII by CS/EP Then by CS/ADJ
group.description: Part B - Arm 3: Participants received IV injection of BAY81-8973 at 20-50 IU/kg 2-3 times per week with BAY81-8973 measured by Chromogenic Substrate Assay Potency Per European Pharmacopeia (CS/EP) for 6 months and then crossed over to study drug measured by Chromogenic Substrate Assay/Adjusted (CS/ADJ) to Label Potency for 6 months

group.title: Arm 4: Recombinant Factor VIII by CS/ADJ Then by CS/EP
group.description: Part B - Arm 4:. Participants received IV injection of BAY81-8973 at 20-50 IU/kg 2-3 times per week with BAY81-8973 measured by Chromogenic Substrate Assay/Adjusted (CS/ADJ) to Label Potency for 6 months and then crossed over to study drug measured by Chromogenic Substrate Assay Per European Pharmacopeia (CS/EP) for 6 months

group.title: Arm 5: Recombinant Factor VIII by CS/EP
group.description: Part C - Arm 5: Participants received a loading dose of approximately 50 IU/kg of BAY81-8973 before the first surgical incision followed by further treatment with BAY81-8973 according to surgical requirements for up to 3 weeks

group.title: Arm 6: Recombinant Factor VIII (BAY81-8973) Part B + Extension
group.description: Participants received IV injections of BAY81-8973 at 20-50 IU/kg 2-3 times per week with BAY81-8973 measured by Chromogenic Substrate Assay Potency Per European Pharmacopeia (CS/EP) for 6 months and CS/ADJ for 6 months sequence according to randomization and up to 12 months (CS/EP) during extension

outcome.title: Part A - Area Under the Drug Concentration-time Curve (AUC)
outcome.description: To examine the Pharmacokinetic (PK) characteristics of BAY 81-8973 and ensure that the new drug is similar to Kogenate FS. All results are based on the chromogenic assay.
outcome.time_frame: Samples taken at pre-injection, and at 0.25, 0.5, 1, 3, 6, 8, 24, 30 and 48 hours post injection. AUC calculated from time of injection to infinity.

group.title: Recombinant Factor VIII (BAY81-8973) - Part A
group.description: Participants received one single intravenous (IV) injection of BAY81-8973 50 IU/kg

group.title: Kogenate FS (BAY14-2222) - Part A
group.description: Participants received one single intravenous (IV) injection of Kogenate FS (BAY14-2222) 50 IU/kg

outcome.title: Part B - Annualized Number of Total Bleeds
outcome.description: The annualized number of bleeds experienced by participants

group.title: Recombinant Factor VIII (BAY81-8973) - Part B
group.description: Participants received IV injections of BAY81-8973 at 20-50 IU/kg 2-3 times per week with BAY81-8973 measured by Chromogenic Substrate Assay Potency Per European Pharmacopeia (CS/EP) for 6 months and by Chromogenic Substrate Assay/Adjusted to Label Potency (CS/ADJ) for 6 months, sequence according to randomization.

measure.title: Part B - Annualized Number of Total Bleeds
measure.description: The annualized number of bleeds experienced by participants

outcome.title: Part B - The in Vivo Recovery Values of Human Factor VIII (FVIII)
outcome.description: The amount of Factor VIII found in blood samples taken after the injection of the study drug at the beginning of the CS/EP treatment period.
outcome.population: ITT. 1 measurement was taken in all participants at the start of the CS/EP labelled treatment period (CS/ADJ labelled treatment was experimental and will not be used for the future commercial drug, so no measurements were taken). Note: Only 59 of the 62 participants had valid recovery data.

group.title: Recombinant Factor VIII (BAY81-8973) by CS/EP - Part B
group.description: Participants received IV injections of BAY81-8973 at 20-50 IU/kg 2-3 times per week with BAY81-8973 measured by Chromogenic Substrate Assay Potency Per European Pharmacopeia (CS/EP) for 6 months

measure.title: Part B - The in Vivo Recovery Values of Human Factor VIII (FVIII)
measure.description: The amount of Factor VIII found in blood samples taken after the injection of the study drug at the beginning of the CS/EP treatment period.
measure.population: ITT. 1 measurement was taken in all participants at the start of the CS/EP labelled treatment period (CS/ADJ labelled treatment was experimental and will not be used for the future commercial drug, so no measurements were taken). Note: Only 59 of the 62 participants had valid recovery data.

outcome.title: Part B - Annualized Number of Bleeds in Each 6-month Potency Assignment Period
outcome.description: The annualized number of bleeds experienced by participants in each of the two treatment periods
outcome.population: ITT. Note: One participant in Part B did not receive any Recombinant Factor VIII measured by the CS/ADJ method, leading to 61 participants (not 62) in that group.

outcome.title: Part B - Changes From Baseline at 12 Months in Quality of Life (QoL) as Measured by Transformed Total Score of Haemo-QoL Questionnaire
outcome.description: A measure of how treatment with BAY81-8973 affected the daily life of participants. the scoring system has 100 points. 0 is the worst possible score. 100 is the best possible score. Positive changes from baseline indicate an improvement in quality of life and negative changes indicate a deterioration.
outcome.population: ITT. Note: Only 51 of the 62 participants had data available for the 12-month QoL analysis.

group.title: Recombinant Factor VIII (BAY81-8973) - Part B
group.description: Participants received IV injections of BAY81-8973 at 20-50 IU/kg 2-3 times per week with BAY81-8973 measured by Chromogenic Substrate Assay Potency Per European Pharmacopeia (CS/EP) for 6 months and by Chromogenic Substrate Assay/Adjusted to Label Potency (CS/ADJ) for 6 months, sequence according to randomization.

measure.title: Part B - Changes From Baseline at 12 Months in Quality of Life (QoL) as Measured by Transformed Total Score of Haemo-QoL Questionnaire
measure.description: A measure of how treatment with BAY81-8973 affected the daily life of participants. the scoring system has 100 points. 0 is the worst possible score. 100 is the best possible score. Positive changes from baseline indicate an improvement in quality of life and negative changes indicate a deterioration.
measure.population: ITT. Note: Only 51 of the 62 participants had data available for the 12-month QoL analysis.

outcome.title: Part B - Changes From Baseline at 12 Months in Utility Index as Measured by EQ–5D Questionaire
outcome.description: A measure of how treatment with BAY81-8973 affected the daily life of participants. 1.0 = Best possible score, -0.594 = Worst possible score. Positive changes from baseline indicate an improvement and negative changes indicate a deterioration.
outcome.population: ITT. Note: Only 61 of the 62 participants had data available for the Utility Index of the EQ-5D questionnaire at Month 12.

group.title: Recombinant Factor VIII (BAY81-8973) - Part B

measure.description: A measure of how treatment with BAY81-8973 affected the daily life of participants. 1.0 = Best possible score, -0.594 = Worst possible score. Positive changes from baseline indicate an improvement and negative changes indicate a deterioration.
measure.population: ITT. Note: Only 61 of the 62 participants had data available for the Utility Index of the EQ-5D questionnaire at Month 12.

group.title: Recombinant Factor VIII (BAY81-8973) - Part B
group.description: Participants received IV injections of BAY81-8973 at 20-50 IU/kg 2-3 times per week with BAY81-8973 measured by Chromogenic Substrate Assay Potency Per European Pharmacopeia (CS/EP) for 6 months and by Chromogenic Substrate Assay/Adjusted to Label Potency (CS/ADJ) for 6 months, sequence according to randomization.

outcome.description: A test to ensure that participants have not developed antibodies that will interfere with the action of BAY81-8973

reported_events.time_frame: From the date of signing informed consent through study completion, i.e. 21 Dec 2009 to 14 Mar 2013
reported_events.desc: The objective of Part C was efficacy assessment of surgery hemostasis, not safety assessment. It was allowed to include the same patient for several surgeries and for each surgery the patient was assigned a new patient number. Due to this approach, one patient with 3 surgeries was analyzed as 3 different patients, therefore the number at risk is 7.

group.title: Recombinant Factor VIII (BAY81-8973) - Part A
group.description: Participants received one single intravenous (IV) injection of BAY81-8973 50 IU/kg

group.title: Kogenate FS (BAY14-2222) - Part A
group.description: Participants received one single intravenous (IV) injection of Kogenate FS (BAY14-2222) 50 IU/kg

group.title: Recombinant Factor VIII (BAY81-8973) Part B and Extension
group.description: Participants received IV injections of BAY81-8973 at 20-50 IU/kg 2-3 times per week with BAY81-8973 measured by Chromogenic Substrate Assay Potency Per European Pharmacopeia (CS/EP) for 6 months and CS/ADJ for 6 months sequence according to randomization and up to 12 months (CS/EP) during extension

group.title: Recombinant Factor VIII (BAY81-8973) by CS/EP - Part C
group.description: Participants in Part C received a loading dose of approximately 50 IU/kg of BAY81-8973 (nearest whole vial amount) for less than 15 minutes before the first surgical incision. Then they received further treatment with BAY81-8973 according to surgical requirements up to 3 weeks.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
